Package jabs.consensus.algorithm

Class Avalanche<B extends Block<B>,T extends Tx<T>>

Object
AbstractConsensusAlgorithm<B,T>
AbstractDAGBasedConsensus<B,T>
Avalanche<B,T>
All Implemented Interfaces:
ConsensusAlgorithm<B,T>, DeterministicFinalityConsensus<B,T>, QueryingBasedConsensus<B,T>
public class Avalanche<B extends Block<B>,T extends Tx<T>> extends AbstractDAGBasedConsensus<B,T> implements QueryingBasedConsensus<B,T>, DeterministicFinalityConsensus<B,T>
File: Avalanche.java Description: Implements Avalanche protocol for JABS blockchain simulator. Author: Siamak Abdi Date: January 30, 2024

    • isStronglyPreferred

      public boolean isStronglyPreferred(AvalancheNode peer, AvalancheTx tx)
      Checks if a given Avalanche node strongly prefers a specific transaction.
      Parameters:
      peer - The Avalanche node in question.
      tx - The transaction to be checked for strong preference.
      Returns:
      True if the transaction is strongly preferred, false otherwise.

    • checkQueries

      private void checkQueries(int inquirerID, AvalancheTx tx, boolean response, AvalancheNode peer)
      Checks and processes queries for a specific Avalanche transaction.
      Parameters:
      inquirerID - The ID of the node making the query.
      tx - The transaction associated with the queries.
      response - The response (positive/negative) to the query.
      peer - The Avalanche node processing the queries.

      Updates preferences and counts for the ancestors of a specific transaction in the local transaction DAG.
      Parameters:
      peer - The Avalanche node initiating the update.
      tx - The transaction whose ancestors' preferences and counts are being updated.

    • getConfidenceValue

      public int getConfidenceValue(AvalancheNode peer, AvalancheTx tx)
      Calculates and returns the confidence value of a specific transaction for a given Avalanche node.
      Parameters:
      peer - The Avalanche node for which the confidence value is calculated.
      tx - The transaction for which the confidence value is determined.
      Returns:
      The calculated confidence value for the transaction.
